alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 5:36AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: Expect around 1 to 3 inches of snow. The Eastern Magic Valley and the Lower Snake Plain from Burley to Pocatello look to have southerly flow ahead of a cold front this afternoon and will likely see the lower end of snowfall of around 1 inch. This southerly flow will likely warm the area, especially the I-84 corridor enough to produce rain as precipitation starts. Winds will be southerly around 10 mph, possible as high as 15 mph. If southerly winds are very light, temperatures will be colder and more than 1 inch of snow will occur along the I-84 corridor. By early evening, after cold front passage, expect westerly winds of 15 mph with gust near 20 to 25 mph mainly the I-84 corridor. For the Upper Snake Plain expect around 2 to 3 inches of snow. The eastern bench of the Lower Snake Plain could see around 3 inches too. Also,there is a chance of convergence band after midnight into early morning from Idaho Falls to Pocatello as well. The chance is low currently. If this occurs the higher end of 3 inches of snow is expected.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Upper Snake River Plain
